# countDownDuration

**Instance Property**

The value displayed by the date picker when the mode property is set to show a countdown time.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var countDownDuration: TimeInterval { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to get and set the currently selected value when the date picker’s mode property is set to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/Mode/countDownTimer]. This property is of type [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/TimeInterval] and therefore is measured in seconds, although the date picker displays only hours and minutes. If the mode of the date picker is not [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/Mode/countDownTimer], this value is undefined; refer instead to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/date] property. The default value is 0.0 and the maximum value is 23:59 (86,340 seconds).

## Configuring temporal attributes

- **maximumDate**: The maximum date that a date picker can show.
- **minimumDate**: The minimum date that a date picker can show.
- **minuteInterval**: The interval at which the date picker should display minutes.
- **roundsToMinuteInterval**: A Boolean value that determines whether the date rounds to a specific minute interval.
